channel.title: Projects on Rebecca Rose Writes
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Rebecca Rose Writes

item.title: Journalism
item.description: Rebecca has a unique voice and isn’t afraid to raise it for an issue she believes in. She has written for a variety of media outlets such as: The Coast, Nova Scotia Advocate, Our Times, DailyXtra.com, Rabble.ca, The Halifax Media Co-op, Autostraddle, the Ryerson Review of Journalism, McClung’s Magazine, and the book OUT: Queer Looking, Queer Acting Revisited. Much of her writing focuses on: politics, social movements, misogyny, rape culture, and gender and sexuality.

item.title: Media Relations Consulting
item.description: A Ryerson journalism graduate and freelance writer, Rebecca also brings over 10 years experience in media relations (for non-profits and community groups) to her media relations workshops. Rebecca has been conducting media relations workshops since 2010 for groups including the Canadian Federation of Students-Nova Scotia (CFS-NS), the Dalhousie Student Union (DSU), the Nova Scotia Rainbow Action Project (NSRAP) and ACORN. These workshops focus on: using media as a tactic (or tool), which compliments your strategy and helps you achieve your goal(s); developing (and sticking to) a message box; how to generate media; crisis management; and what to do when the media calls.

item.title: Social Media Consulting
item.description: Like many 30-somethings, Rebecca has spent her entire adult life on social media. Additionally she has helped run social media accounts for various non-profit and community groups including: Friends of the Khyber, Leave Out ViolencE (LOVE) Nova Scotia, Hope Blooms and the Canadian Freelance Union (CFU). Rebecca has been facilitating workshops on social media since 2013 to audiences with a wide range of tech backgrounds: from people who have never used a computer to those who obsessively check Facebook on their phone.

item.title: Speaking
item.description: Rebecca is a sought-after MC and speaker who has hosted or spoken at a wide variety of events including: the “Who’s Space? Student Space!” panel at Ryerson University (2016), a workshop on rape culture for VOX: A Choir for Social Change (2016), the 2015 NSRAP Gala (co-keynote speaker with Robin Metcalfe), the 2014 International Day Against Homophobia and Transphobia (MC), the 2011 Solidarity Halifax conference (MC), and the 2010 and 2013 Halifax Dyke and Trans March (speaker).

item.title: Writing
item.description: Rebecca oscillates between writing articles for both online and print publications and part-time writing contracts for non-profit, government, and private clients.
